intro: Pimpinella etbaica, commonly known as the Ethiopian cumin, is a herbaceous annual plant native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters, typical of the family. Its seeds are aromatic and have been traditionally used in Ethiopian cuisine and herbal medicine. Pimpinella etbaica thrives in temperate climates and is adapted to high-altitude environments.
